ext x
apply Iff.intro
intro h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff] at h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff] at h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff]
rewrite [mem_inter_iff]
-- see h and parse according to it, h1: (x ∈ A ∧ x ∈ B) ∧ x ∈ C 
-- so it means h1.1 = x ∈ A ∧ x ∈ B , h1.2 = x ∈ C 
exact ⟨h1.1.1, h1.1.2, h1.2⟩
intro h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff] at h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff] at h1
rewrite [mem_inter_iff]
rewrite [mem_inter_iff]
--- h1:x∈A ∧ x∈B ∧ x∈C is parsed as x∈A ∧(x∈B ∧ x∈C) because ∧ is right-associative. 
---- h1.1:x∈A , h1.2:x∈B∧x∈C, h1.2.1:x∈B, h1.2.2:x∈C
exact ⟨⟨h1.1, h1.2.1⟩, h1.2.2⟩

intro t
intro
-- h1:F⊆G : means ∀s,s∈F→s∈G
-- h2:∀t∈G,x∈t: means ∀t,t∈G→x∈t
-- from a we have t ∈ F so h1 a becomes h1 a = t ∈ G because h1 takes any s ∈ F and shows
-- s ∈ G
-- so applying h2 to t and h1a gives x ∈ t
exact h2 t (h1 a)

6.code:
intro x hx
by_contra hx_not_in_intersect
rcases hx with ⟨hx_in_F, hx_in_G⟩
rcases hx_in_F with ⟨S, hS_in_F, hx_in_S⟩
have hS_not_in_G : S ∉ G := by
  by_contra hS_in_G
  have hx_in_FG : x ∈ ⋃₀ (F ∩ G) := ⟨S, ⟨hS_in_F, hS_in_G⟩, hx_in_S⟩
  exact hx_not_in_intersect hx_in_FG
have hS_in_Gc : S ∈ Gᶜ := hS_not_in_G
have hS_in_F_cap_Gc : S ∈ F ∩ Gᶜ := ⟨hS_in_F, hS_in_Gc⟩
have hx_in_union_FGc : x ∈ ⋃₀ (F ∩ Gᶜ) := ⟨S, hS_in_F_cap_Gc, hx_in_S⟩
have hx_in_target := h1 hx_in_union_FGc
exact hx_in_target.right hx_in_G

have hex_v : ∃ v ∈ G, x ∉ v := by
  by_contra h_all_in
  push_neg at h_all_in
  exact hx_not_in_inter_G h_all_in
obtain ⟨v, hv_in_G, hx_not_in_v⟩ := hex_v
have hx_in_vc : x ∈ vᶜ := hx_not_in_v
have hx_in_u_cap_vc : x ∈ u ∩ vᶜ := ⟨hx_in_u, hx_in_vc⟩
use u ∩ vᶜ
constructor
use u, hu_in_F, v, hv_in_G
exact hx_in_u_cap_vc

8.code:
have h2 := h1 {s | ∃ x ∈ A, s = {x}}
have union_eq : ⋃₀ {s | ∃ x ∈ A, s = {x}} = A := by
  ext y
  constructor
  intro hy
  rcases hy with ⟨s, ⟨x, hx_in_A, hs_eq⟩, hy_in_s⟩
  rewrite [hs_eq] at hy_in_s
  rewrite [mem_singleton_iff] at hy_in_s
  rewrite [hy_in_s]
  exact hx_in_A
  intro hy_in_A
  use {y}
  constructor
  use y, hy_in_A
  rfl
have hA_in_family := h2 union_eq
rcases hA_in_family with ⟨x, hx_in_A, hA_eq⟩
use x
